How does the study suggest TEMPRO could: By identifying and optimizing nanobody candidates with high binding affinity and stability.
By predicting the exact binding sites on the SARS-CoV-2 spike protein.
By generating new nanobody sequences specifically targeting SARS-CoV-2.
By simulating the interaction dynamics between nanobodies and SARS-CoV-2 variants.
What does the study propose as a future: Identifying specific amino acid residues that influence Tm and making targeted mutations.
Developing new protein language models for better prediction accuracy.
Creating a database of nanobody sequences with known binding affinities.
Implementing real-time monitoring of nanobody interactions with SARS-CoV-2.
What is the primary function of the TEMP: To predict the melting temperature (Tm) of nanobodies using computational methods.
To identify potential binding sites on SARS-CoV-2 variants.
To simulate the folding process of nanobodies.
To generate new nanobody sequences with enhanced binding affinity.
Which feature was found to significantly: ESM embeddings derived from pre-trained transformer protein language models.
